name: Royal Magda Etoile Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Recently stayed for 4 nights at this hotel. The location is excellent. Shopping, sightseeing, and such easy access to a large metro station. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The room was small, but that's not unexpected in Paris. We were in a deluxe suite. The room was a bit musty smelling and seemed really worn (carpets stained, bedspreads worn). The bed was extremely hard and uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Good location and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: However, for the price and location I would say this hotel is a good choice. Just don't expect that you're getting much luxury and you'll be fine.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel ,close to walk to everything and free WiFi. The staff were very freindly and helpful and breakfast was hot and tasty. We had a great 5 days here.
reviews.title: Charming hotel just minutes from the Arc de Triomphe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel staffed by friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are small but this is to be expected in Paris. Room looked like it had been recently renovated and was clean. There was no air con so it was a bit stuffy but the windows can be opened.
reviews.title: Wonderful Staff and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is fantastic - close to everything you need! Good deals are available on the hotel's website.
reviews.title: great choice in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a lovely stay at the Royal Magda Etoile.
reviews.title: Royal Magda is Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Plus Points
reviews.title: Small but good

likes.liked: — Clean room, modern amenities, friendly staff

reviews.title: I Loved the Hotel . Excellent !!!!
reviews.text: Location - superb, 2 mins walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the same distance from the CDG Etoile Metro/RER station.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service - staff were very friendly without exception and happy to help with any queries or emergencies (lent us a large umberella for the tennis at Roland Garros!)
reviews.title: credit card # STOLEN from room safe!

likes.liked: — located very close to arc de triomph
likes.disliked: — they stole my credit card identity and used it for personal charges after i left france!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel - small but very clean, quality fixtures and fittings throughout. A relaxed, comfortable atmosphere.
reviews.title: Quaint and tidy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: Just two words: absolutely excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent
Great Little Hotel!
reviews.text: I booked at the Royal Magda because we needed a reasonably priced hotel, and it was conveniently located near the Arch de Triomphe and was rated highly in TripAdvisor. I was a little nervous about what I would find, but this turned out to be a great choice. Beautiful, clean, small boutique hotel, near the Metro, tour buses, etc. Easy to find. Room was typically small, but very clean and comfortable. Even a new flat screen tv. Bathroom small but seemed newly renovated and very clean. Nice little touches. The staff was EXCELLENT! Two very wonderful girls manned the desk during the days and they were so eager to please and helpful, we could not have hoped for better. The gentlemen on duty overnight (the front desk is staffed 24 hrs. a day) was also very accommodating and pleasant. This hotel was a joy and we were so pleased with the choice. Thank you to the Royal Magda for a great stay in Paris! Given the chance, I will definitely stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: A small but perfectly formed hotel a two minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe. The staff were brilliant, friendly and welcoming and the rooms were spotlessly clean. It is a great base for exploring Paris, with many things within walking distance, but if the legs get tired there's a taxi station at the top of the road and the metro two minutes away.
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel in centre of Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel, as would the rest of my family.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel was imaculate, our room was spotless, tastefully decorated and quite comfortable for a very small space. The reception staff were helpful, courteous and attentive.....excellent!
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a very pleasant staff.
reviews.title: Good value hotel - some street noise

likes.liked: — Proximity to Arch de Triomphe and metro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found out about the Hotel Magda through Trip Advisor back in September. My husband and I just returned from Thanksgiving weekend in Paris. The Hotel Magda did not disappoint. We were immediately upgraded to a suite upon our arrival - at ten am! Allowing us to check into our room so early (after an eight hour flight) was fantastic. The only thing missing was a down comforter, but in Paris, I could do without!
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!
friendly warm hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is in an amazing location about two blocks from the Arc de Triomphe. It is also two blocks away from Metro line 1 which is one of the main arteries of the city. It took us almost everywhere we needed to go - and we only had to transfer once to get anywhere else. This was ideal. We never had to take a taxi.

reviews.title: Little Star
reviews.text: We ate breakfast in the hotel each day which was convenient, but there were also many options close by. I would highly recommend the restaurant Citrus Etoile which was only a few blocks away from the hotel. It is operated by an American woman, Elizabeth, and her husband who is a French native. We had our best meal at their restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff at the Hotel Magda was extremely helpful and attentive. I am grateful to all of those who reveiwed the hotel before me b/c I probably wouldn't have found this gem otherwise. I can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: During our 3 day stay at the Hotel Royal Magda, we were made to feel very welcome. On arrival, the hotel was very warm and welcoming, the decor was very chic and the Hotel was exceptionally clean. Our room was excellent, it had eveything we needed and was kept clean during our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent in every respect

likes.liked: — The friendliness of the staff and the cleanliness of the hotel, great room
likes.disliked: — the lift was a bit small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rogal Magda is an excellent boutique hotel. Very clean with excellent service and a tremendous value. Steps from the Arc de Triomphe, metro, and Champs Elysees. Very easy to book directly with hotel, everything completed easily through email with very quick responses. The only "con" is that the rooms are small, but the quality and cleanliness is all that matters. Eat at Brasserie Lorraine, worth the price for excellent service and "3 star Michelin" food.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, tremendous value

likes.disliked: — Rooms are small, but it's a boutique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from Paris after staying a long week-end at the Royal Magda with our 8 and 6 year old. We had a deluxe suite which is basically 2 rooms divided by an arch with a king size in one and a made up sofa bed in the other. Both rooms had a tv and the bathroom was lovely - sparkling clean - as was the rest of the hotel. We had good bathroom toiletries and the shower was excellent. The staff were very accommodating. We were very close to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. As other guests have stated, all transport was just at the end of the street too. All in all the location was great. We ate at Hippopotamus which was lovely and good for children, we also ate at Bistro Romain on Champs Elysees (top floor - good view of Champs at night). We had a one breakfast at Cafe de Flore on Boulevard Sain-Germain which was wonderful and worth the visit (one of the oldest cafes in Paris), and we had a lovely breakfast at the hotel one day. All in all a lovely trip!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in a Great location!

likes.disliked: — Breakfast could be included in the cost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the way Trip Advisor is supposed to work. My wife and I were looking for a good deal at a smaller hotel so we pulled up TA and, at the time, the Magda was #1 or #2 and it had a number of glowing reviews. We took other travelers' advice and it was exactly what we expected. Yohann (and the others at the front desk) was extremely helpful and made some outstanding recommendations for dinners and nightlife.
reviews.title: C'est fantastique!
Great location, great hotel
reviews.text: If you are like us and would rather spend more money on actiivties and great meals than you would on the hotel, but still need a clean, safe place to sleep, this hotel is perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Royal Magda Etoile Hotel in Paris is one of the best deals in Paris. I have been at the Royal Magda Etoile twice during the last 6 months, and each time I received an outstanding treatment from the great staff. The rooms were always very clean, comfortable, and quiet. During the last visit (Febr 2008), I was upgraded to a large suite at no charge. The position of the Hotel is excellent, just in front of the Arc de Triomphe, minutes away from several Metro stations and the RER (train) station. In addition, the Hotel is minutes away from the Bus stop of the Air France shuttles that provide the fastest connection to both Airports in Paris (CGD and Orly). The only weakness of the Magda is probably the breakfast, but there are plenty of Cafes around to get fresh croissants. I strongly recommend the Royal Magda Etoile Hotel to business travelers (Paris Congress Center is only minutes away), to tourists and to everybody that want to enjoy Paris at an affordable price range.
reviews.title: Oustanding Value in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I can expect better tha this hotel in Paris?
reviews.title: Love it !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best location - near Metro station and easy access to any place in guide book.
reviews.title: friendly and cozy hotel !!

likes.liked: — comfortable of the room and front desk service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008
reviews.text: nice pople - very helpful receptionists and stuffs. Surprisingly, room keepers can speak in English well.
reviews.title: Superb in many ways!!!!

likes.disliked: — beds could be a little softer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I immediately felt so nice when I have entered a room since I have smelt very nice from the room.
reviews.title: Loved the Royal Magda Etoile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel over the Easter week-end and let me just tell you what a fantastic time we had. We flew from Shannon to Paris Beauvais airport, shuttle bus dropped us at the Port Maillot, which is only 2 stops away by Metro from the hotel, but we decided to have a little walk and less than 10 min later we were in the welcoming lobby of the Royal Magda Etoile. Check in was so quick and efficient that in no time we were going up in the tiny elevator to our room on the 6th floor. As mentioned before – rooms are small but have everything you need, bed is extremely comfortable and bathroom is full size with a bathtub with a very good water pressure in the shower. Our room no 611 had a lot of windows which made our room feel very bright even on the dull, rainy day (yes, the weather was very bad all week-end). We didn’t have breakfast in the hotel, but it smelled lovely every morning in the lobby. Location of the hotel is fantastic; you are 2 min walk from the Arc de Triomph, Champs Elysee and metro station. You are only few minutes away from great selection of restaurant, bars, shops and etc. And this good location means a lot, especially if the weather is so bad and rain is just pouring non-stop, we could run to restaurants, metro and even La Duree (for some macaroons) without getting soaked wet :) Check out was as quick as check in and took less than 5 min, giving us time for a cup of coffee before our bus trip to Beauvais airport. Despite the bad weather we had an amazing week-end in Paris and we would like to thank all the fantasticl staff for making our stay so pleasant. For the price you pay for this hotel I would rate Royal Magda Etoile as a hidden gem of Paris.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read all the glorious reviews on trip advisor, I can now confirm that the Royal Magda Etoile lives up to its reputation. The location was wonderful - right beside the Metro line and only a stone's throw from the Arc de triomphe and the Champs-Elysées. That was especially good as we used to take a stroll down the Champs-Elysées after our dinner and browse in some of the shops (that opened till all hours) or go for dessert to Laduree.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Instead of using the mini bar facillities, we went to monoprix on Avenue des Ternes and stocked up on water and Champagne (well, we were in Paris). Whilst on Avenue des Terres I found a wonderful street which was down the side of the Naf Naf shop. The street was full of the most amazing produce and speciality food shops and is definitely worth a visit - just to pick up a non touristy flavour of Paris.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were thrilled with our room, which was on the 5th floor and had a little balcony and whilst the rooms are small, they are perfectly formed. The place was spotless and the staff were very helpful and I can't wrap up my review without mentioning the marvellous leopard print carpet on the stairs and landing.......... just an added bonus when staying in my favourite hotel in paris.
reviews.title: Boutique hotel - right in the centre of Paris
Would stay here again
reviews.text: My wife and two teenaged daughters just got back from a week stay in Paris at the Royal Magda Etoile Hotel. Everything from the staff (front desk, breakfast room, maids), to the rooms (clean, modern), to the location (literally 2 min. walk to the Arc d'Triomphe) was great. Flor and the other two girls at the front desk were extremely helpful in making suggestions/reservations for dinner. For the price, one just cannot go wrong by staying at this beautiful little hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Loved the hotel. Used to stay at Ecole Centrale, in Marais area. Same price range. Magda is more comfortable, better located and with better service (the people at the reception are very correct, "almost nice".
reviews.title: Excelent Choice!

likes.liked: — Location and Comfort of the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: we chose this hotel based on tripadvisor revues and were not disappointed. the lasting memory will be the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. the woman on front desk was exceptional.
reviews.title: great front of house, boutique at 3 star prices
Nice but Rock Hard Beds!!
reviews.text: we were traveling with our two young girls (3 + 6) and stayed in one of the deluxe suites, which was small but ok for paris at this price. the second bed folded away to a sofa, which was handy for watching cartoon network before bed (they should rename it the tom and jerry channel!) the sofa bed was narrower than the main bed but very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: location was just round the corner from the arc de triomphe, handy for the metro and the eiffel tower but a bit away from the centre. several kid friendly decent restaurants were within easy walking distance. free wifi in the lounge area but not in the bedrooms.
reviews.title: absolutely perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: Bath room is quite big if you compare than any hotel in Paris. I felt this hotels hospitality from complementary Bath salt.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in Paris

likes.liked: — Location and small hotel charm with good qualities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect for Paris.
reviews.title: Perfect for Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got details from Tripadvisor and knew the downsides - small lift (no problem if there are just 2 of you), door doesnt lock automaticaly (so --- what!) only camplaint is that the walls are a little thin (but not too bad)
reviews.title: Adequate

likes.disliked: — Did not quite live up to my expectations

reviews.title: Great find
reviews.text: The upsides which are location, clean, great staff, close to metro, value for money make this an excellent choice and I would def stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Six months ago we stayed at the Hotel Splendid Etoile in Paris based on the rating and reviews on the Trip Advisor web site. The hotel was better than the reviews.
reviews.title: Good for the price.

likes.liked: — The polite staff at the front desk
likes.disliked: — The cleaning crew leaving us without toilet paper and soap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In planning another trip to Paris (Dec, 06), I consulted Trip Advisor to find a better rating for the Royal Magda Etoile. Although the room was clean, spacious and adequate, it was no more.
reviews.title: A little Gem!
Very clean and great location
reviews.text: I recently returned from my stay at this hotel. As a first-time single traveler, I felt very safe in this neighborhood and was pleased to find the metro station within a few blocks walking distance. My room was spotless each evening I returned from my day out. All staff I dealt with were courteous and very helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Royal Magda is located blocks from the metro and the Champs Elysees. The room was a little small, but very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just got back after a 4 day stay in Paris and this hotel indeed deserves it's reputation as being one of the better rated hotels in Paris. Booked the hotel through the reviews from this website and being the first time using it's reviews, was abit nervous but keen on finding out what all the good reviews was all about.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was ideally located at the Arc De Triomphe, only a street away from the bus stop (if taking the Air France bus from CDG airport) and just behind the CDG Etoile metro stop. We arrived early in the morning and the reception staff were kind, polite, receptive and allowed us to store our bags while waiting for our room to be ready (and we actually left and started sightseeing anyways!)
reviews.title: Great hotel - easily worth the rating

likes.disliked: — slightly snotty receptionist - expensive bar prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with a friend at the Royal Magda Etoile for a few nights at the end of February. The first thing I liked was the location. It is so close to the Arc de Triomphe and the rest of the main sites in Paris that it saved a lot of travel time when we headed out to see the city. The front desk staff was extremely nice, very friendly and helpful. Also, the room looked exactly as it did on the hotel's website. It is the best hotel I have ever stayed at in Paris. I would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Loved the Magda

likes.liked: — the location and the friendly staff

reviews.title: Great Spot
reviews.text: Booked this hotel for 2 nights for my wife’s birthday based on the reviews on this site and was not disappointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: On arrival we were upgraded to a bigger room which set the tone perfectly. The rooms were good size but most importantly spotless. The bathrooms were immaculate and the rooms had all the basic facilities.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Although the hotel is not bang in the heart of the tourist areas ie. Latin Quarter, St Germain, Eiffel Tower etc, its proximity to the underground means it really doesn’t make that much of a difference as the nearest underground station is quite a large one and services the bulk of the tourist areas in a matter of minutes plus the area around the hotel is very good as well (2 min walk to Arc De Triumph).
reviews.title: Better than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: In addition to the quality of the hotel, the staff were amazingly helpful. Flore, who was on reception for most of the time we were there, helped us immensely, particularly by recommending some fantastic restaurants for the night of my wife’s birthday as I would have been lost otherwise. She was helpful to a fault and always happy which makes a big difference to guests.
reviews.title: This is why you're on tripadvisor...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a three day stay at the Royal Magda. The hotel is modern and sophisticated in terms of decor. We were greeted by a friendly staff who seemed to be friendly to tourists who speak English. We stayed in a double room, which was small in comparison to the average American room, but quite cosy and included free internet access, a flat screen t.v. and a wonderful bathroom, equipped with a nice shower. Additionally we found the balcony to offer a wonderful respite and peek into parisian life. The street the Royal Magda is located on, is quiet but within walking distance to the Arc de Triumph, Champs-Elysees and the Metropolitan stop.
reviews.title: Excellent value and great location!

likes.liked: — Value for the money, location and service

reviews.title: value for money
reviews.text: Overall, for the value, there is nothing better. This hotel offers the best in amenities at a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: Au revoir
reviews.title: The best!

likes.disliked: — cost of the breakfast in the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March 07' with my husband and young children and would recommend it for most travellers.
reviews.title: Good vist at the Magda

likes.liked: — Nice room, location to metro stop, value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: The hotel undoubtedely has a fantastic location - literally turn the street corner and your faced with the Arc de Triomphe. The hotel is small, well run and clean with staff who are very helpful and pleasant. We booked a Junior Suite which was spacious with a large double bed and a very comfortable sofa bed. Unfortunately the rooms look out onto a small court yard but considering the price and the location, its not a big deal. The only other details that may need to be taken into consideration is that the lift is tiny and therefore more than one trip may be required for luggage/ prams etc. and the walls are a little on the thin side but these are very insignificant gripes when taking into account all the many positives the hotel has to offer.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Lovely Hotel , good location, excellent rooms and service. Very clean, good rooms and bathrooms. Very good taste on the decoration of rooms and lobby. Personell very friendly and helpfull. Great breakfast.
reviews.title: Sounds not too good......

likes.disliked: — High noise levels between rooms & floors.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Royal Magda with my girlfriend to celebrate our first anniversary. What a place to stay!! A stone throw away from the Arc De Triumph, the location was superb! The service and friendly staff topped our magical experience. No wonder this Hotel was recommended to me. We got to our room to find some nibbles on our desk with a bottle of Champagne on ice and a note saying, “We hope you have a very enjoyable first Anniversary in Paris”. Fantastic!! That started what was a very memorable weekend. The hotel was elegant, our room view of Paris with the small balcony was amazing. I could type for hours! You want to experience a memorable stay in Paris, go to this hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sam| Broker
reviews.title: Great location, great service, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a Saturday night in November, very nice hotel, very convenient location, close to the 1, 2, and 6 metro lines, handy for most of the big attractions. Room was nice and clean, standard size. Big plus was the staff were very friendly and helpful, very good for recommending how to plan your day in the city and where to eat etc. Would definately stay here again, fantastic value.
reviews.title: still great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the reviews that praise the location and cleanliness are correct. My wife and I have stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile 5 times and will stay again. The real advantage and pleasure in staying here in Paris, is the staff. Yohan and Lilly at the desk are superb and speak flawless English. Everyone else , including housekeeping, night clerks and breakfast waitstaff are great, and that is what makes the visits so pleasant. It is true that it may be time to replace the carpet in a couple of rooms, but those rooms are absolutely spotless nevertheless.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We love the area and have been pleasantly surprised with some of the local restaurants and shops. Book "Le Hide" for dinner. It is a great choice for your last night - right around the corner with terrific, interesting food. Check with Yohan for local cafes and walking distance sights. We found a nice antique shop nearby. Just explore, and don't be afraid to stroll the neighborhood. Yes the Champs Elysees is right around the corner, but walk around the Avenue Mac Mahon, and the Rue de Wagram too. Believe it or not, the MacDonalds on the corner has good salads unlike anything you would get in the states -cheap and a quick good value. If you like classical music, book a concert at the "Salle Pleyel" on line, a world class concert hall within walking distance that even has pretty good pre concert dinners.
reviews.title: Just right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited this hotel during a recent weekend. The previous reviews are accurate = good service & great location (to Metro, Air France Shuttle, Champ Elysees).
reviews.title: Great Hotel, but Beware the French ;-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We arrived early and had to leave our bags, while we explored the area. When we came back they had already placed our bags into our room (nice touch). The elavator is SUPER tiny, so get ready to make several trips.
reviews.title: Perfect 3 stars hotel - Arc de Triomphe

likes.disliked: — the lack of coffee in the room

reviews.title: Loved everything about the hotel from the reception, to the check out
reviews.text: We would recommend a Suite, as the rooms are very tiny. With the Junior Suite we were able to fit our bags, no problem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was somewhat clean - some dirt near door, which was odd - but the bathroom was very clean.
reviews.title: a little gem in the heart of Paris

likes.disliked: — apart from breakfast, no food served

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family of four; with one 15 year old daughter and one 11 year old daughter stayed for two nights. Of course rooms were small [Paris, city typical]. We had suite #411, 4th floor which consisted of two rooms and bathroom. The first living room was small and when couch folded out to bed it took up whole room, and bathroom was directly off this room, so noise could be heard from bathroom to people sleeping here. Also, hotel has "hard wired LAN connection in room" and "wireless" in lobby. So I could not get up early to surf internet/ do work as small desk where LAN was located was on side of daughters bed. Had to go to lobby. Breakfast was 12 euros extra, but McDonalds 50 meters away... but McDonalds does not open until 7:30 AM which is really 7:45 AM as workers move slowly here. To sum up room, although not spacious, it was clean and modern. The bathroom was modern. This is what we really wanted and we got- clean and modern. Yes the elevator only fits one person, so use the stairs.
reviews.title: Pretty Good, We were Happy.

likes.disliked: — need wireless in rooms, need coffee in rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The biggest bonus is location! We were very happy with location. When I booked, I thought I would have to take my family to Latin quarter to show off cafe's, patisseries, and French street character... but no, the neighborhoods around Magda are great. One block from Arc-de-Triumph and can catch Metro anywhere from here. But one block in the other direction are trendy streets with cafe's and shops. My 15 year old was in and out of all, looking for a certain type of gladiator sandal that she saw all the girls wearing.
reviews.title: Not as I had hoped for.

likes.disliked: — The noise in our room at night from the disco next door. We could hear people talking!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For two nights, avoiding the big brand name hotels, this boutique hotel was just fine. Again, clean and modernized which we think are most important.
reviews.title: Good Location

likes.liked: — Location - near to Metro and Arc De Triumph

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: After reading all the review of this hotel on Trip Advisor we decided to book. There were 9 of us in all. I was expecing more that we got. The hotel staff was pleasant and tried to be helpful. My room was on the 6th floor, and the bed was against the wall. My husband kept hitting his head getting in and out of bed. The room was also very hot. I ask if we could move, and the hotel did move us to the 1st floor. What a mistake. The last night we were there, a disco next door was playing music so loud I felt like I was sleeping in the middle of the club. Needless to say, I did not sleep at all. Having to get up and leave very early in the morning to catch a train to Bordeaux left me totally exhausted. They should not use that room!! It was a nightmare!! I left my camera in the room. I tried to contact the hotel to see if they found it, but have heard nothing back. I would call this a mediocre hotel at the most. I would not go back.
reviews.title: Paris with Henry

likes.disliked: — no place to park and unload outside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The first thing we noticed was the great location of this hotel. As mentioned in the other reviews, only a couple of minutes from the Arc De Triumphe. It is also a very short walk to the Metro which, in my opinion, is the fastest and most convenient way to get around Paris.
reviews.title: Wonderful:)

likes.disliked: — can't think of anything at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: Great hotel in an excellent location. Room was very clean, staff was friendly, very helpful and speak English for those not fluent in French. 5 minute walk to the "RER" station and Champs Elysees and the Arch of Triumph. Very easy to navigate to/from CDG airport and the sites from this location. Will definetly book this hotel again when I return for my next visit to Paris.
reviews.title: Perfect Paris Holiday
Great staff and nice location!
reviews.text: - Friendly, and very helpful staff. Always a smile!

reviews.title: The Perfect Paris Hotel
reviews.text: - Housecleaning staff very good. Everything was spotless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: - It is very close to the Arc de Triumphe and the Metro/RER. Very nice location.
reviews.title: Great in everyway, prime location and attentive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006
reviews.text: - The buffet breakfast is 12E. A basic selection, but items are fresh.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: What a lovely hotel, especially for 99 Euros a night in mid-January. The hotel is a mere block from the Arc de Triomphe and two blocks from the Air France Express Bus to CDG Airport. The service was friendly, and everyone spoke English when my French stumbled.
reviews.title: Royal Magda Etoile reviews are true!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I traveled solo for a long week-end holiday to the City of Lights. Although my room was small, it was certainly more than adequate enough for me. The sheets were soft and comfortable, the room and bathroom were immaculately serviced each day, and there was wireless internet access available. For such a small hotel, I was surprised to find that the hotel offers room service and a mini-bar (although I did not partake in either).
reviews.title: Everything we expected and more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006
reviews.text: The breakfast may be expensive for some at 12 Euros (it was not included in the room price I was quoted), but it consisted of a nice assortment of breads, croissants, cereals, yogurt, meats and cheeses. The breakfast area is quiet and comfortable--a nice place to plan your day over an endless cup of hot coffee.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. What more can I say?
Great Hotel. Couldn't fault the professionalism or the location.
reviews.text: Overall, I find it hard to believe you can beat the value this hotel offers.

reviews.title: Class on a budget
reviews.text: HINT: Although most people would rather visit Paris during the spring and summer when Paris is in full bloom, don't neglect this city during the off months. Airfares are a bargain (I paid $550 round-trip from Newark Liberty), the tourist sites are empty, and in January especially, all of the stores have great sales. Even with the weaker dollar, I spent over $300 on great deals at the Men's store Madelios.

reviews.title: Very pleasant and comfortable stay - first time in paris
reviews.text: Booked through venere.com at an excellent rate, we arrived sans baggage thanks to US Airways misconnects but our disappointment with our luggage quickly eroded when we checked in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff are extremely helpful and pleasant, with excellent english, and the hotel itself is cute, efficient in use of space and felt very comfortable. Nice comfortable yet firm mattress in our room and open windows that were tall balcony like so plenty of air. Quiet side street but main roads a few blocks away so some noise, but we are in a city.....Bathrooms and showers were very nice (good hot shower) and whilst the room was small, this is what you would expect for a decent inner city hotel.
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic location (Arc de Triomph), near RER/Metro lines, and right next to the Air France bus so getting to and from airport is trivially simple, timely and cheap.
reviews.title: Friendly and clean
Great Staff and location
reviews.text: Theres a bar up the block and across the street open to 2am (La Flamme) expensive but nice for a late night night cap, though cocktails there were a bit low on the "kick" side :)

reviews.title: Excellence in Paris
reviews.text: We didnt try the breakfast or bar in the hotel - there are plenty of places in the city. Would I stay again ? Absolutely. Any newbies to Paris - hit the Marais area, latin Quarter, St Germain area, and spend time on foot as well as on metro for a quick intro to great city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: This was a spur of the moment trip and I booked my room the night before. I was pleasantly surprised to find that my room was ready even though i arrived a little before check-in time. It was Labor Day and I received a tiny bouquet in celebration upon check-in. My French is high school and VERY basic but the staff spoke English and made everything easier. My room was small by American standards but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. I slept very well and I usually have trouble sleeping when I'm away from home. The hotel was close to Metro and L'Arc de Triomphe but a little bit of a hike to other attractions. It was also on a small side street and as I was a solo traveler, that made it a little less attractive. I think breakfast was included but I preferred to walk the neighborhoods and taste the local fare.
reviews.title: This hotel made me a believer in tripadvisor.com

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Magda Etoile for 3 nights in early October and loved it. When researching hotels we found the reviews on TA really helpful and the location made this an ideal choice for us. Not only was it a 10 minute walk from our bus drop off point, the hotel was soooo easy to find as you're literally 2 mins from the Arc de Triomphe. We had the last room (616) at the top of the hotel on the 6th floor.
reviews.title: Cinq Etoiles for the Magda

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was at the back of the hotel so was really quiet despite being next to the lift shaft. Sure it didn't have an automatic lock but it's a typical Parisien building, it's part of the charm. The room was spotless, the bathroom was gleaming and had a super hot shower and an amazing heated towel rail with plenty of big, fluffy white towels. The mini bar was well stocked and not overly expensive and there was also room service, sadly we didn't have any. Breakfast was served between 7am-12pm which was great cos it meant we could relax and not stress about getting down in time for breakfast. What can I say about breakfast, it was divine, not to everyones tastes I'm sure, but it had fresh meats and cheese and the most amazing fresh bread, croissants, pastries and home-made mini donuts. There were also various cereals, yogurts and fresh juice and a welcoming friendly waitress asking if you wanted cafe, te or chocolat. A continental breakfast!!! Always served with a smile.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean and close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front of house staff were very pleasant and extremely helpful and all spoke English perfectly. There was also free wifi in the lobby but on request, my husband was given a network cable to use in the room - free of charge. We were also able to leave our luggage in the hotel after we checked out (12pm checkout) as our flight wasn't til late in the evening - no problem at all. A few people have commented that this hotel isn't central, I would disagree heartily as the metro is 2 mins away and is only a few stops from all the major tourist attractions, what more do you want! There are lots of lovely bars and restaurants in the area and strangely the ones we frequented had no tourists and seemed to be filled with Parisiens which made it all that more enjoyable, the prices were no more expensive than other areas we had visited. What helped also, was the amazing deal we got, so if you want a clean, central, friendly hotel with nice breakfast, then this is it. We'll definitely return and recommend to all our friends and family who are planning a trip to Paris.
reviews.title: We will always go back...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived a little early, but our room was ready which was great. The staff was very helpful throughout our entire stay of 4 nights. Very clean, comfortable and cozy. We were only 2 blocks from the Arc de Triomphe and the Metro. Lots of stuff to do within walking distance. We would definately go back, though maybe it could have been a little less expensive, but we did get a good value
reviews.title: Great, they were so helpful after a run-in with the Belfast Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from 4 nights in Paris where we stayed at the Hotel Magda. The experience was very nice as the room was tiny but very clean as was also the bathroom. We marvelled at the comfortable bed and were appreciative of the quiet street that let us sleep after a day of exhausting but exhilarating sight seeing. The location is right near the Metro, the L'arc Du Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. The staff were very polite and friendly as well as professional. We enjoyed our stay for our first visit to Paris.
reviews.title: Clean, convenient and pleasant staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was amazing, the rooms were clean but very tiny, the location was good (around the corner from Arc de Triomphe). However, next door to the hotel is an after bar which is open between 2am - 8am. The street is so narrow that the patrons from the bar can be heard for miles. Apparently the weekend we were there was the last weekend the bar was to be opened - (you should confirm with hotel first).
reviews.title: GREAT SERVICE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Had it not been for the after hours bar our stay would have been perfect.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Home for the Week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to a friend only if the after bar was indeed closed.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Look no further! This is your hotel!! . My husband had a conference in the 17th Arr. and although we looked there, we decided we would stay elsewhere. Not familiar with Paris, we decided that an "apartment" would be the best choice as we were traveling with our two teenage children and needed the sleeping space. During one of my nights researching an apartment, I stumbled on this hotel. I really thought this was too good to be true. The ratings were excellent (#6 of 1200 hotels) and the location seemed to be perfect. We reserved a suite and hoped for the best. So....? It was truly wonderful. We arrived on a red-eye flight from the US at 6 am. We took the RER and the metro as directed. . Our first Paris experience? We emerged from the metro and were facing the Arc D"Triomphe. A short two block walk and we arrived at our "home". I'm in love!!! Clean, roomy, exceptional staff, great location, quiet. At each block end, there were great resturants, bakerys, and small boutiques. When needed, there was a McDonalds. (We stopped for french fries once). The metro was there to take us anywhere. The staff were very helpful and very kind to our excited US teenagers. My husband and I enjoyed one evening in the lounge/bar area with a glass of wine. In a nutshell, this was the perfect place and we are so happy to have found you Royal Magda! When we return to Paris? We will stay here with you. Thanks for a dream trip in Paris!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, not huge fan of location

description: A few steps from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysées, the turning of a small street between the Avenue de Wagram and Avenue Mac Mahon, the HôtelRoyal Magda Etoile enjoys an exceptional situation.At the heart of a Haussmann building of charm, we have chosen for you the soft toned ! Eastern and bright for the reception, lounges and breakfast. Natural and pure in the rooms for a deserved rest and relaxation assured.
